com.imperio

Interface OptionCallback


  • public interface OptionCallback
    This class is used as a container for the callback function used by ImperioApp.
    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void callback(ImperioApp impApp, Option opt, java.lang.Object oldVal, java.lang.Object val)
      When an option has been processed, this function will be called if the option's callback object has been set.

    • Method Detail

      • callback

        void callback(ImperioApp impApp,
            Option opt,
            java.lang.Object oldVal,
            java.lang.Object val)
              throws ImperioException
        When an option has been processed, this function will be called if the option's callback object has been set.
        Parameters:
        impApp - Imperio application instance
        opt - the last option that was processed
        oldVal - the value of the provided option before processing the latest instance of it
        val - If the option takes an argument, this is the value of the argument of the most recent instance of the option. If the option does not take an argument, this is the new value of the option after processing the most recent instance of the option.
        Throws:
        ImperioException - if an error occurs
        Since:
        1.0.0
